frame.name: Relational_quantity
frame.definition:
<def-root>A quantity, the <fen>Numerator</fen>, can be understood in terms of how it relates to another quantity, the <fen>Denominator</fen>; the comparison of these two numbers is called the <fen>Rate</fen>. The nouns in this frame may denote the <fen>Rate</fen> unless the referent is specifically expressed. This frame is a general description of the relationship between any two dependent quantities; children of this frame may describe situations in which the scale of the <fen>Numerator</fen> and/or the <fen>Denominator</fen> is fixed.
<ex>I'm not paying the <fex name="Descriptor">high</fex> <fex name="Type">interest</fex> <fex name="Rate"><t>rates</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>The nest egg is going to be taxed at a <fex name="Type">federal</fex> <t>rate</t> <fex name="Rate">of about 55 percent</fex>.</ex>
<ex>This assumption is commonly adopted in statistical models that are used to estimate the <fex name="Type">transmission</fex> <fex name="Rate"><t>rate</t></fex> <fex name="Focal_entity">of HIV</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>The number which represents the relative quantities of the <fen>Numerator</fen> and the <fen>Denominator</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Numerator
FE.definition: <def-root>Identifies the quantity whose magnitude is determined relative to the <fen>Denominator</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Focal_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The set of things to which the <fen>Rate</fen> pertains.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Any characteristic of the <fen>Rate</fen> that is not covered by another more specific FE.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>A name of the <fen>Rate</fen> of or description of the particular category the <fen>Rate</fen> belongs to.</def-root>

FE.name: Denominator
FE.definition: <def-root>The quantity whose magnitude is determined relative to the <fen>Numerator</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: rate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a numerical representation of the comparison of two numbers
